title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
text: data frame 100 rows 3 columns: R0 integer, basic reproductive ratio: average number secondary infections produced infected person completely susceptible population. VE numeric, vaccine efficacy, representing reduction susceptibility infection. Value numeric, relative force infection produced quarantine breaches.

title: COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset â€” covid19
text: dataset based Figure 3 Zachreson et al. (2022), demonstrates relative force infection quarantine breaches scales vaccine efficacy (VE) basic reproductive ratio virus (R0). Blue dotted box: baseline scenario (R0 = 3, VE = 0), consistent pre-Delta outbreak data. Green dotted box: vaccinated quarantine pathways Delta. Yellow dashed box: plausible scenarios Delta variant.

code: # View the first rows head(covid19) #>   R0  Value  VE #> 1  1 0.0170 0.9 #> 2  1 0.0167 0.8 #> 3  1 0.0370 0.7 #> 4  1 0.0402 0.6 #> 5  1 0.0607 0.5 #> 6  1 0.0972 0.4  # Plot heatmap (using helper function from package) if(require(ggplot2)) {   plot_covid("All") } #> Loading required package: ggplot2 #> Error in plot_covid("All"): could not find function "plot_covid"  # Plot line plot for a specific R0 plot_covid(3) #> Error in plot_covid(3): could not find function "plot_covid"
